issue.title: Odd wording for bitset equality operators

discussion.p: The following wording seems a little unusual to me:

blockquote.p: -42- Returns: A nonzero value if the value of each bit in *this equals the value of the corresponding bit in rhs.
-43- Returns: A nonzero value if !(*this == rhs).

discussion.p: "A nonzero value" may be well defined as equivalent to the literal 'true' for Booleans, but the wording is clumsy. I suggest replacing "A nonzero value" with the literal 'true' (in appropriate font) in each case.

blockquote.p: It's obviously editorial. There's no need for further discussion.
-42- Returns: A nonzero value true if the value of each bit in *this equals the value of the corresponding bit in rhs.
-43- Returns: A nonzero value true if !(*this == rhs).
